heisig_chinese_memo: If you eat lots of wheat, you'll grow up to have strong walking legs.
koohiiStory1: BARLEY beverages give GROWN UPs teetering WALKING LEGS.
koohiiStory2: "Grown up" barley, i.e. beer, is what gets you tottering legs.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The life radical is without the slide (as it sometimes is), but when you combine that with the winter you have life during winter. What gives you life during the winter? It's the wheat you store away.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine you're starving. It's cold and you've run out of food. You don't know what you're going to do. If you don't find something, you'll lose your life. Then, you break open a barrel, and wheat pours out. It's beautiful. You just found some life in the middle of winter.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You found your wheat. Thank God. You'll survive. You have to take the wheat back to your house, though. On your way, you get mugged („ÇÄ„Åé).
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine the disappointment. You go from finding life to losing it all... now you have no hope for the winter :( Also, keep in mind that „ÇÄ„Åé and mug aren't super-alike, so you'll have to use it to get close enough to remember the actual reading, „ÇÄ„Åé.

chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The taskmaster is always late, "Yea, I'm comeing, I'll be right there! Wheat a few seconds!"
origin_of_ch_char_book: (‰æÜ, Êù•, lai, come) This character originally meant barley (È∫•, È∫¶, mai, wheat; barley). According to the ancient scripts, this character meant ‚Äúto receive holy barley.‚Äù In other words, it meant that heaven (Â§©, tian=t‚Äôien) gave barley to humanity; the sacred barley came from heaven. Therefore the character came to mean ‚Äúto come.‚Äù

wheat
Basic explanation of words
wheat
(wheat)
m√†i
One-year or two-year-old herbaceous plants, including "wheat", "barley", "oats", etc. The seeds are used for grinding noodles and can also be used to make sugar or wine. Usually refers specifically to "wheat" (commonly known as "wheat"): wheat field. wheat harvest. Wheat rice bean soup (referring to farmer's coarse tea and light rice).
name.
wheat
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[‚ë†]Ôºªm√†iÔºΩ
["Guangyun" is not cut, enter the wheat, Ming. ]
Also known as "Mai 1".
(1) Annual or biannual herbaceous plants. The seeds are used to grind into flour, and can also be used to make sugar or wine. They are important food crops in northern my country. There are many kinds of wheat, barley, rye, oats and so on.
(2) The abbreviation of Maxwell.
(3) Last name. Sui You Mai Tiezhang. See the biography of "Sui Shu".
wheat

Radicals: Áîü, Â§Ç  (life, winter)
Meaning Mnemonic
The life radical is without the slide (as it sometimes is), but when you combine that with the winter you have life during winter. What gives you life during the winter? It's the wheat you store away.
Imagine you're starving. It's cold and you've run out of food. You don't know what you're going to do. If you don't find something, you'll lose your life. Then, you break open a barrel, and wheat pours out. It's beautiful. You just found some life in the middle of winter.
Reading Mnemonic
You found your wheat. Thank God. You'll survive. You have to take the wheat back to your house, though. On your way, you get mugged („ÇÄ„Åé).
Imagine the disappointment. You go from finding life to losing it all... now you have no hope for the winter :( Also, keep in mind that „ÇÄ„Åé and mug aren't super-alike, so you'll have to use it to get close enough to remember the actual reading, „ÇÄ„Åé.
